title: Refactor `Interpreter.Run` to separate body from error clearing
body:
# Rationale

In the context of customizing the EVM, we need to be aware that `Interpreter.Run` [here](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/core/vm/interpreter.go#L107)  did have an `errStopToken`. However, this is being cleared at the end of the function, which make sense, since it's an internal error, but it would be useful for having that info for a library that build on top of `geth` and wants to know this detail (my case).

# Implementation

This feature doesn't imply any feature change to the `Interpreter.Run` function, but a refactor that will separate the body of the function, from the clearing of the error. The function could look something like this

```go
func (in *EVMInterpreter) Run(contract *Contract, input []byte, readOnly bool) (ret []byte, err error) {
	
        in.CallRunBody(...)

	if err == errStopToken {
		err = nil // clear stop token error
	}

	return res, err
}
```

This would make `Interpreter.CallRunBody` available for developers not willing to clear the `errStopToken` error.

I could do a PR for this, if this is something you would consider having in the codebase
